content:
[
  {
    "question_text": "What was a major cause of the French Revolution?",
    "options": [
      "Excessive taxation on the poor",
      "Lack of religious freedom",
      "Overpopulation in urban areas",
      "Desire for colonial expansion"
    ],
    "correct_option_index": 1,
    "explanation": "The French government's excessive taxation on the lower and middle classes, combined with a severe economic crisis, were major factors that led to the outbreak of the French Revolution.",
    "difficulty": "Medium",
    "type": "mcsc"
  },
  {
    "question_text": "What was the significance of the storming of the Bastille?",
    "options": [
      "It marked the beginning of the French Revolution",
      "It led to the abolition of the monarchy",
      "It resulted in the execution of King Louis XVI",
      "It caused the end of the Reign of Terror"
    ],
    "correct_option_index": 1,
    "explanation": "The storming of the Bastille on July 14, 1789 was a pivotal event that symbolized the start of the French Revolution, as it marked the people's revolt against the absolute monarchy.",
    "difficulty": "Easy",
    "type": "mcsc"
  },
  {
    "question_text": "What was the primary goal of the Reign of Terror during the French Revolution?",
    "options": [
      "To establish a democratic government",
      "To eliminate all political opposition",
      "To expand French colonial territories",
      "To restore the monarchy"
    ],
    "correct_option_index": 2,
    "explanation": "The Reign of Terror, led by Robespierre, was a period of violence and repression aimed at eliminating all perceived enemies of the French Revolution, in order to consolidate the new revolutionary government.",
    "difficulty": "Hard",
    "type": "mcsc"
  },
  {
    "question_text": "What were some of the key causes of the French Revolution?",
    "options": [
      "Economic inequality and high taxes",
      "Influence of Enlightenment ideas",
      "Resentment towards the monarchy",
      "Crop failures and famine"
    ],
    "correct_option_indices": [
      0,
      1,
      2
    ],
    "explanation": "The French Revolution was sparked by a combination of economic inequality, the influence of Enlightenment ideas, and resentment towards the monarchy's absolute power and lavish spending.",
    "difficulty": "Medium",
    "type": "mcmc"
  },
  {
    "question_text": "What was the significance of the Storming of the Bastille?",
    "options": [
      "It marked the beginning of the French Revolution",
      "It led to the abolition of the monarchy",
      "It was a symbolic act of defiance against the king",
      "It resulted in the execution of Louis XVI"
    ],
    "correct_option_indices": [
      0,
      2
    ],
    "explanation": "The Storming of the Bastille on July 14, 1789, was a pivotal event that marked the start of the French Revolution. It was a symbolic act of defiance against the monarchy and its oppressive policies.",
    "difficulty": "Easy",
    "type": "mcmc"
  },
  {
    "question_text": "What were the key features of the Reign of Terror during the French Revolution?",
    "options": [
      "Mass executions of suspected enemies of the revolution",
      "Establishment of a new republican government",
      "Suppression of political dissent and opposition",
      "Expansion of civil liberties and individual rights"
    ],
    "correct_option_indices": [
      0,
      2
    ],
    "explanation": "The Reign of Terror was a period of violence and political repression during the French Revolution, characterized by mass executions of suspected enemies of the revolution and the suppression of political dissent and opposition.",
    "difficulty": "Hard",
    "type": "mcmc"
  },
  {
    "question_text": "Describe the key social and economic factors that led to the outbreak of the French Revolution. Discuss how these factors created the conditions for revolutionary change.",
    "model_answer": "The key factors that led to the French Revolution included:\n- Economic hardship and famine among the lower classes due to poor harvests, high food prices, and heavy taxation\n- Resentment towards the privileges and extravagance of the French nobility and clergy\n- Influence of Enlightenment ideas about individual rights, equality, and representative government\n- Dissatisfaction with the absolute monarchy of King Louis XVI and his ineffective leadership\n- Growing sense of national identity and desire for more political participation among the French people\n\nThese factors created widespread discontent and a revolutionary atmosphere, setting the stage for the dramatic events of 1789 such as the Storming of the Bastille.",
    "explanation": "This question asks the student to demonstrate their understanding of the complex social, economic, and political factors that contributed to the outbreak of the French Revolution. A strong answer will identify and explain the key drivers of revolutionary sentiment, showing how they created the conditions for the revolutionary upheaval that followed.",
    "difficulty": "Medium",
    "type": "subjective"
  },
  {
    "question_text": "Describe the significance of the Storming of the Bastille and explain how it became a symbolic event of the French Revolution.",
    "model_answer": "The Storming of the Bastille on July 14, 1789 was a pivotal event in the early stages of the French Revolution. The Bastille was a fortress and prison that had become a symbol of the absolute power of the French monarchy. When a crowd of Parisians, angered by food shortages and the actions of the king, stormed and captured the Bastille, it marked the start of the revolutionary period.\n\nThe Storming of the Bastille was significant for several reasons:\n- It was a dramatic display of popular resistance against the monarchy and its oppressive policies\n- It provided the revolutionaries with a large supply of weapons and ammunition to continue their fight\n- It galvanized the revolutionary spirit and inspired further uprisings across France\n- The date of July 14th became a national holiday (Bastille Day) that continues to be celebrated in France as a symbol of the country's democratic values\n\nOverall, the Storming of the Bastille became a powerful symbolic event that encapsulated the revolutionary fervor and the people's desire to overthrow the old order and establish a new, more equitable system of government.",
    "explanation": "This question focuses on the significance and symbolic importance of the Storming of the Bastille, a pivotal early event in the French Revolution. A strong answer will explain how this dramatic action captured the revolutionary spirit, provided material resources for the revolutionaries, and became an enduring symbol of France's democratic ideals.",
    "difficulty": "Medium",
    "type": "subjective"
  }
]
